title.rendered: ICSPR Summer Program in Quantitative Methods of Social Research

content.rendered:
Registration for the 2014 ICPSR Summer Program in Quantitative Methods of Social Research is open! 

According to their website (http://www.icpsr.umich.edu/icpsrweb/sumprog/), the ICPSR Summer Program provides a comprehensive, integrated program of studies in research design, statistics, data analysis, and social science methodology. Its instructional environment stresses integration of methods of quantitative analysis within a broader context of substantive social research.

When the 2014 schedule is finalized, it will list over 90 beginning and advanced courses at the primary location in Ann Arbor and several “off-site” institutions.

NYU is an ICPSR member institution, so NYU students and faculty are eligible for the discounted fees. There are also several competitive scholarships available for the longer sessions (info is here).

If you have any questions, feel free to get in touch with Data Services (data.services@nyu.edu) or contact the ICPSR summer program staff directly.
